param.name: input_data
param.label: Input evidence table
param.help: Input file is the evidence.txt table from MaxQuant

param.name: input_annotations
param.label: Sample annotations table
param.help: A data table specifying metadata; sample annotations.

param.name: runcol
param.label: Which column specifies the run identifier and batch name?
param.help: Column to specify both the run identifier and batch name, has to be present in both tables.

param.name: remove_empty_columns
param.label: Remove empty columns?
param.help: Whether the empty columns should be removed.

param.name: generate_QC_plots
param.label: Generate QC plots?
param.help: Whether to generate quality-control plots (distribution of the average SCR, distribution of median CV and median intensities).

param.name: filter_reverse
param.label: Filter reverse sequences?
param.help: Whether to filter the proteins labelled as 'reverse'.

param.name: filter_contaminants
param.label: Filter potential contaminants?
param.help: Whether to filter the proteins labelled as 'potential contaminant'.

param.name: PIF_threshold
param.label: Parental ion fraction (PIF) threshold
param.help: The threshold for parental ion fraction (PIF)

param.name: minimum_features
param.label: Minimum number of PSMs per assay required
param.help: What is the minimum number of peptide-to-spectrum matches per assay to keep the assay?

param.name: count_cell_carrier
param.label: Number of cells in the carrier channel
param.help: What is the number of cells in the carrier channel?

param.name: single_cells
param.label: Single-cell channels present in the experiment
param.help: What are the single-cell channels present in the experiment? At least one channel must be selected!

param.name: SCR_threshold
param.label: Mean SCR threshold
param.help: Mean sample-to-carrier (SCR) threshold. 0.1 corresponds to 10%

param.name: qvalue_level
param.label: Filter based on PSM, peptide or protein-level q-values?
param.help: Whether to perform the q-value computation and filtration on the PSM, peptide or protein level.

param.name: qvalue_threshold
param.label: q-value threshold
param.help: Q-value threshold.

param.name: divide_reference
param.label: Compute relative reporter ion intensities?
param.help: Whether to compute the relative reporter ion intensities by dividing the single-cell intensities by the reference channel. Specific for SCOPE2 data.

param.name: aggregation_peptides
param.label: Which function to use for the aggregation?
param.help: How to aggregate PSMs to peptides?

param.name: column_aggregation_peptides
param.label: Which column should be used for the PSM to peptide aggregation?
param.help: Which column should be used for the PSM to peptide aggregation.

param.name: samples_to_keep
param.label: Which samples to keep?
param.help: Which samples to keep? We recommend filtering out Carrier and Unused channels at this step.

param.name: cut_median_intensity
param.label: Filter based on median relative intensity?
param.help: Whether to filter based on median intensity.

param.label: Median intensity threshold
param.name: median_intensity_threshold
param.help: Threshold for relative median intensity filtering.

param.name: cut_median_CV
param.label: Filter based on median CV?
param.help: Whether to filter based on median CV.

param.label: How many peptides per protein are required to compute CV?
param.name: minimum_peptides_CV
param.help: Minimum number of peptides per protein required for the CV computation.

param.label: Median CV threshold
param.name: median_CV_threshold
param.help: Threshold for median CV filtering.

param.name: remove_blank
param.label: Remove blank sample?
param.help: Whether to remove the blank sample. If it has been already removed, set to 'false'.

param.label: How to perform normalization?
param.name: choose_normalization
param.help: How to normalize peptide intensities?
param.option: Normalize columns or normalize rows (one only).

param.label: Normalization method
param.name: normalize_simple_method
param.help: Which normalization method to choose?

param.label: Normalization method columns
param.name: normalize_columns
param.help: Which normalization method to choose for columns?

param.label: Normalization method rows
param.name: normalize_rows
param.help: Which normalization method to choose for rows?

param.label: Log transformation base
param.name: base
param.help: Which base to use for the log transformation?

param.name: remove_peptides
param.label: Remove peptides with high missing rate?
param.help: Whether to remove the peptides with the high missing rate.

param.label: % of NA values filtering threshold
param.name: pNA_peptides
param.help: If peptide has this % of missing values, it will be removed.

param.name: aggregation_proteins
param.label: Which function to use for the aggregation?
param.help: How to aggregate PSMs to proteins?

param.name: column_aggregation_proteins
param.label: Which column should be used for the peptide to protein aggregation?
param.help: Which column should be used for the peptide to protein aggregation.

param.label: How to perform normalization?
param.name: choose_normalization_protein
param.help: How to normalize protein intensities?
param.option: Normalize columns or normalize rows (one only).

param.label: Normalization method
param.name: normalize_simple_method_prot
param.help: Which normalization method to choose?

param.label: Normalization method columns
param.name: normalize_columns_prot
param.help: Which normalization method to choose for columns?

param.label: Normalization method rows
param.name: normalize_rows_prot
param.help: Which normalization method to choose for rows?

param.label: Which k to use for the kNN imputation?
param.name: impute_k
param.help: Number of k-nearest neighbours to consider for kNN imputation.

param.label: Which batch correction method to use?
param.name: batch_correction_method
param.help: Which method to use for correcting the batch effect?

param.name: batch_col
param.label: Which column is the technical variable to be corrected?
param.help: Column to specify both the run identifier and batch name, has to be present in both tables.

param.name: preserve_col
param.label: Which column is the variable to be preserved?
param.help: Which column is the variable to be preserved.

param.name: batch_col
param.label: Which column is the technical variable to be corrected?
param.help: Column to specify both the run identifier and batch name, has to be present in both tables.

param.label: Run principal component analysis (PCA)?
param.name: run_PCA
param.help: Run the PCA on imputed batch-corrected protein intensities?

param.label: Number of components
param.name: ncomponents_PCA
param.help: Number of components in the PCA analysis.

param.label: Run UMAP on PCA data?
param.name: run_UMAP
param.help: Run the UMAP on PCA-reduced data?

param.label: Number of components
param.name: ncomponents_UMAP
param.help: Number of components in the UMAP analysis.

param.name: export_tables
param.label: Export intermediate results
param.help: Whether only the final result table (log2 transformed, normalized, imputed, batch-corrected data) should be exported or all intermediate results.
